result.execSummary:
The defendant Scotty D Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

BTC: Vacate warrant. **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**  Bond to be set at $750.00 cash. No alc/cs-ZCI.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ZCI
Donald Conner

Defendant Scotty D Ward in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. Defense indicates that due to the statement on Pg 12 in PSI, defense cannot represent the deft adequately and indicates there may be an issue of competency. The Court agrees that the deft has some difficulty understanding at times but is not certain it rises to the level of competency. Defense indicates that although they do not believe there is an issue of competency, the statement may be misconstrued as defense is not representing deft as vigorously as he should. The State agrees with Mr. Hamad. The State also notes that on Pg 4 of the PSI, the deft makes statement that he was 'supposed' to get probation but the State notes that at no time was there discussion of probation.

BTC: Matter to be adj for at least 30 days. SPD to reappoint as Mr. Hamad may withdraw. Subsequent counsel may have access to PSI  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:**** CONDITIONS MODIFIED TO:***Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exception are going to court, work and meeting w/his Atty. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03-16-2015 - MAY REMOVE GPS. DEFENDANT MUST MAKE ALL FUTURE COURT APPEARANCES. THERE WILL BE NO EXCUSE ACCEPTED FOR MISSED APPEARANCES. DEFENDANT IS NOT TO BE IN ANY HOME WHERE THERE MAY BE ILLEGAL NARCOTICS.
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scotty D Ward in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking that GPS be removed as a condition of his bond. The State is objecting to the request due to the fact that deft has another pending file and there have been multiple addresses/residences that the deft has been purportedly living although the State does concede that there have been no GPS violations.

BTC: bond modification is granted. GPS may be removed. Additional conditions - must make ALL court appearances. There will be no excuse for missing a court date and deft may not be in a residence where there may be illegal narcotics.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
